author: ppf.
content: is devnet5 the last 4844 before hitting goerli?

author: dimitry8570
content:
can someone explain me the logic of serializing an ssz container ? 

```

{A: '0x3e', B: '0x02', C: '0x01', D: '0x75', E: '0x1d'} 
==>
0b00000002010c0000001d3e75

0b000000 (11) uint32
02
01

0c000000  (12) uint32
1d
3e
75
```

author: __flcl
content:
4bytes offset dynamic entity A
1byte fixed-size entity B
1byte fixed-size entity C
4bytes offset dynamic entity D
1byte fixed-size entity E
value of 1st dynamic entity A
value of 2nd dynamic entity D

author: __flcl
content: static part contains offsets and fixed-size entities; dynamic part goes after and contains dynamic-size entities

author: __flcl
content:
0xb = sizeof(offset) + sizeof(B) + sizeof(C) + sizeof(offset)  + sizeof(E)
0xc = 0xb + sizeof(A)

sizeof(offset) is always 4

author: dimitry8570
content: how do I tell which entity is dynamic and which is fixed-size?

author: dimitry8570
content: it just looks as a container. all values are the same

author: __flcl
content: SSZ does not contain type info, you need to know your type structure. When you know it you can choose using https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/ssz/simple-serialize.md#variable-size-and-fixed-size

author: __flcl
content: Some of them may be List[byte, N]

author: dimitry8570
content: ah so It is just that I don't know the structure still from this test
